018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022
023import java.util.Comparator;
024
025import org.apiguardian.api.API;
026import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
029
030/**
031 *  <p>{@summary Several range checking functions.}</p>
032 *  <p>The functions in this class support range checking for various types.
033 *  This can be especially useful for scripting, but is also usable in other
034 *  contexts.</p>
035 *
036 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
037 *  @thanks Ben Gidley
038 *  @version $Id: RangeFunctions.java 574 2019-04-16 18:33:24Z tquadrat $
039 *  @since 0.0.7
040 *
041 *  @UMLGraph.link
042 */
043@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
044@UtilityClass
045@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: RangeFunctions.java 574 2019-04-16 18:33:24Z tquadrat $" )
046@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
047public final class RangeFunctions
048{
049        /*--------------*\
050    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
051        \*--------------*/
052    /**
053     *  No instance is allowed for this class.
054     */
055    private RangeFunctions() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( RangeFunctions.class ); }
056
057        /*---------*\
058    ====** Methods **==========================================================
059        \*---------*/
060    /**
061     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}.
062     *
063     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
064     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
065     *  @param  floor   The border value.
066     *  @param  include {@code true} if the border is included,
067     *      {@code false} if not.
068     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
069     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
070     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot;,
071     *      respectively.
072     */
073    public static <T> boolean isAbove( final Comparable<T> value, final T floor, final boolean include )
074    {
075        requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" );
076        requireNonNullArgument( floor, "floor" );
077
078        final var retValue = include ?
079            value.compareTo( floor ) >= 0 :
080            value.compareTo( floor ) > 0;
081
082        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
083        return retValue;
084    }   //  isAbove()
085
086    /**
087     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}.
088     *
089     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
090     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
091     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
092     *  @param  floor   The border value.
093     *  @param  include {@code true} if the border is included,
094     *      {@code false} if not.
095     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
096     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
097     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot;,
098     *      respectively.
099     */
100    public static <T> boolean isAbove( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T floor, final boolean include )
101    {
102        requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" );
103        requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" );
104        requireNonNullArgument( floor, "floor" );
105
106        final var retValue = include ?
107            comparator.compare( value, floor ) >= 0 :
108            comparator.compare( value, floor ) > 0;
109
110        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
111        return retValue;
112    }   //  isAbove()
113
114    /**
115     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}. If
116     *  {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor} is included,
117     *  otherwise it is not part of the range.
118     *
119     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
120     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
121     *  @param  floor   The border value.
122     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
123     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
124     */
125    public static <T> boolean isAbove( final Comparable<T> value, final T floor )
126    {
127        final var retValue = isAbove( value, floor, false );
128
129        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
130        return retValue;
131    }   //  isAbove()
132
133    /**
134     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}. If
135     *  {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor} is included,
136     *  otherwise it is not part of the range.
137     *
138     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
139     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
140     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
141     *  @param  floor   The border value.
142     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
143     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
144     */
145    public static <T> boolean isAbove( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T floor )
146    {
147        final var retValue = isAbove( comparator, value, floor, false );
148
149        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
150        return retValue;
151    }   //  isAbove()
152
153    /**
154     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}.
155     *
156     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
157     *  @param  floor   The border value.
158     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
159     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
160     */
161    public static boolean isAbove( final char value, final char floor ) { return value > floor; }
162
163    /**
164     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}.
165     *
166     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
167     *  @param  floor   The border value.
168     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
169     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
170     */
171    public static boolean isAbove( final double value, final double floor ) { return value > floor; }
172
173    /**
174     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is above {@code floor}.
175     *
176     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
177     *  @param  floor   The border value.
178     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
179     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
180     */
181    public static boolean isAbove( final long value, final long floor ) { return value > floor; }
182
183    /**
184     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
185     *  If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code ceiling} is included,
186     *  otherwise it is not part of the range.
187     *
188     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
189     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
190     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
191     *  @param  include {@code true} if the border is included,
192     *      {@code false} if not.
193     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
194     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
195     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;less or equal&quot;,
196     *      respectively.
197     */
198    public static <T> boolean isBelow( final Comparable<T> value, final T ceiling, final boolean include )
199    {
200        requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" );
201        requireNonNullArgument( ceiling, "ceiling" );
202
203        final var retValue = include ?
204            value.compareTo( ceiling ) <= 0 :
205            value.compareTo( ceiling ) < 0;
206
207        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
208        return retValue;
209    }   //  isBelow()
210
211    /**
212     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
213     *  If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code ceiling} is included,
214     *  otherwise it is not part of the range.
215     *
216     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
217     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
218     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
219     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
220     *  @param  include {@code true} if the border is included,
221     *      {@code false} if not.
222     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
223     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
224     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;less or equal&quot;,
225     *      respectively.
226     */
227    public static <T> boolean isBelow( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T ceiling, final boolean include )
228    {
229        requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" );
230        requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" );
231        requireNonNullArgument( ceiling, "ceiling" );
232
233        final var retValue = include ?
234            comparator.compare( value, ceiling ) <= 0 :
235            comparator.compare( value, ceiling ) < 0;
236
237        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
238        return retValue;
239    }   //  isBelow()
240
241    /**
242     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
243     *
244     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
245     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
246     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
247     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
248     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
249     */
250    public static <T> boolean isBelow( final Comparable<T> value, final T ceiling )
251    {
252        final var retValue = isBelow( value, ceiling, false );
253
254        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
255        return retValue;
256    }   //  isBelow()
257
258    /**
259     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
260     *
261     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
262     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
263     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
264     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
265     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
266     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
267     */
268    public static <T> boolean isBelow( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T ceiling )
269    {
270        final var retValue = isBelow( comparator, value, ceiling, false );
271
272        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
273        return retValue;
274    }   //  isBelow()
275
276    /**
277     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
278     *
279     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
280     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
281     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
282     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
283     */
284    public static boolean isBelow( final char value, final char ceiling ) { return value < ceiling; }
285
286    /**
287     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
288     *
289     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
290     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
291     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
292     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
293     */
294    public static boolean isBelow( final double value, final double ceiling ) { return value < ceiling; }
295
296    /**
297     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is below {@code ceiling}.
298     *
299     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
300     *  @param  ceiling The border value.
301     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is less than the given
302     *      border value, {@code false} otherwise.
303     */
304    public static boolean isBelow( final long value, final long ceiling ) { return value < ceiling; }
305
306    /**
307     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
308     *  {@code ceiling}. If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor}
309     *  and {@code ceiling} are included, otherwise they are not in the range.
310     *
311     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
312     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
313     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
314     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
315     *  @param  include {@code true} if the borders are included,
316     *      {@code false} if not.
317     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
318     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
319     *      {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
320     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot; and
321     *      &quot;less or equal&quot;, respectively.
322     */
323    public static <T> boolean isBetween( final Comparable<T> value, final T floor, final T ceiling, final boolean include )
324    {
325        final var retValue = isAbove( value, floor, include ) && isBelow( value, ceiling, include );
326
327        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
328        return retValue;
329    }   //  isBetween()
330
331    /**
332     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
333     *  {@code ceiling}. If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor}
334     *  and {@code ceiling} are included, otherwise they are not in the range.
335     *
336     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
337     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
338     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
339     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
340     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
341     *  @param  include {@code true} if the borders are included,
342     *      {@code false} if not.
343     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
344     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
345     *      {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
346     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot; and
347     *      &quot;less or equal&quot;, respectively.
348     */
349    public static <T> boolean isBetween( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T floor, final T ceiling, final boolean include )
350    {
351        final var retValue = isAbove( comparator, value, floor, include ) && isBelow( comparator, value, ceiling, include );
352
353        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
354        return retValue;
355    }   //  isBetween()
356
357    /**
358     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
359     *  {@code ceiling}. If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor}
360     *  and {@code ceiling} are included, otherwise they are not in the range.
361     *
362     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
363     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
364     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
365     *  @param  include {@code true} if the borders are included,
366     *      {@code false} if not.
367     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
368     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
369     *      {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
370     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot; and
371     *      &quot;less or equal&quot;, respectively.
372     */
373    public static boolean isBetween( final char value, final char floor, final char ceiling, final boolean include )
374    {
375        final var retValue = include ?
376            (value <= ceiling) && (value >= floor) :
377            (value < ceiling) && (value > floor);
378
379        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
380        return retValue;
381    }   //  isBetween()
382
383    /**
384     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
385     *  {@code ceiling}. If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor}
386     *  and {@code ceiling} are included, otherwise they are not in the range.
387     *
388     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
389     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
390     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
391     *  @param  include {@code true} if the borders are included,
392     *      {@code false} if not.
393     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
394     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
395     *      {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
396     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot; and
397     *      &quot;less or equal&quot;, respectively.
398     */
399    public static boolean isBetween( final double value, final double floor, final double ceiling, final boolean include )
400    {
401        final var retValue = include ?
402            (value <= ceiling) && (value >= floor) :
403            (value < ceiling) && (value > floor);
404
405        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
406        return retValue;
407    }   //  isBetween()
408
409    /**
410     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
411     *  {@code ceiling}. If {@code include} is {@code true}, {@code floor}
412     *  and {@code ceiling} are included, otherwise they are not in the range.
413     *
414     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
415     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
416     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
417     *  @param  include {@code true} if the borders are included,
418     *      {@code false} if not.
419     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
420     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
421     *      {@code false} otherwise. If {@code include} is
422     *      {@code true}, it will be &quot;greater or equal&quot; and
423     *      &quot;less or equal&quot;, respectively.
424     */
425    public static boolean isBetween( final long value, final long floor, final long ceiling, final boolean include )
426    {
427        final var retValue = include ?
428            (value <= ceiling) && (value >= floor) :
429            (value < ceiling) && (value > floor);
430
431        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
432        return retValue;
433    }   //  isBetween()
434
435    /**
436     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
437     *  {@code ceiling}.
438     *
439     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
440     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
441     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
442     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
443     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
444     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
445     *      {@code false} otherwise.
446     */
447    public static <T> boolean isBetween( final Comparable<T> value, final T floor, final T ceiling )
448    {
449        final var retValue = isBetween( value, floor, ceiling, false );
450
451        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
452        return retValue;
453    }   //  isBetween()
454
455    /**
456     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
457     *  {@code ceiling}.
458     *
459     *  @param  <T> The type of the values to check.
460     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used for the comparison.
461     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
462     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
463     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
464     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
465     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
466     *      {@code false} otherwise.
467     */
468    public static <T> boolean isBetween( final Comparator<T> comparator, final T value, final T floor, final T ceiling )
469    {
470        final var retValue = isBetween( comparator, value, floor, ceiling, false );
471
472        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
473        return retValue;
474    }   //  isBetween()
475
476    /**
477     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
478     *  {@code ceiling}.
479     *
480     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
481     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
482     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
483     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
484     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
485     *      {@code false} otherwise.
486     */
487    public static boolean isBetween( final char value, final char floor, final char ceiling ) { return isBetween( value, floor, ceiling, false ); }
488
489    /**
490     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
491     *  {@code ceiling}.
492     *
493     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
494     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
495     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
496     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
497     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
498     *      {@code false} otherwise.
499     */
500    public static boolean isBetween( final double value, final double floor, final double ceiling ) { return isBetween( value, floor, ceiling, false ); }
501
502    /**
503     *  Returns {@code true} if {@code value} is between {@code floor} and
504     *  {@code ceiling}.
505     *
506     *  @param  value   The value to compare.
507     *  @param  floor   The lower border value.
508     *  @param  ceiling The upper border value.
509     *  @return {@code true} if the given value is greater than the given
510     *      lower border value and less than the given upper border value,
511     *      {@code false} otherwise.
512     */
513    public static boolean isBetween( final long value, final long floor, final long ceiling ) { return isBetween( value, floor, ceiling, false ); }
514}
515//  class RangeFunctions
